did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, financial and legal records, minutes, printed matter, and photographs, relating to the Russian Center of San Francisco, the San Francisco newspaper Russkaia zhizn', and various aspects of Russian history and Russian émigré affairs.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Anatole S. Loukashkin Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

altformavail.head: Location of Originals
altformavail.p: Originals in: Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco.

chronitem.event: Appointed director, Muzei Obshchestva izucheniia Man'chzhurskogo kraia, Harbin, China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: A. S. Loukashkin was a biologist and the director of the Muzei Obshchestva izucheniia Man'chzhurskogo kraia in Harbin, China, and the Museum of Russian Culture in San Francisco, California. He also served on the boards of the Russian Center and Russian Life Corporation, which published the newspaper Russkaia zhizn' (San Francisco, California); two series so named reflect his activities in these organizations. The collection contains a small number of Loukashkin's scientific writings and a large quantity of collected materials on a variety of subjects, primarily Russians in China, the United States, and other countries. The PRINTED MATTER series contains rare issues of Russian émigré periodicals, especially those published in China.

Detailed processing and preservation microfilming for these materials were made possible by a generous grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and by matching funds from the Hoover Institution and Museum of Russian Culture. The grant also provides depositing a microfilm copy in the Hoover Institution Archives. The original materials remain in the Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco as its property. A transfer table indicating corresponding box and reel numbers is available at the Hoover Institution Archives.

The Hoover Institution assumes all responsibility for notifying users that they must comply with the copyright law of the United States (Title 17 United States Code) and Hoover Rules for the Use and Reproduction of Archival Materials.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Articles, poetry and translations, arranged chronologically by title

did.unittitle: Russian Center of San Francisco File, 1930-1975.

scopecontent.p: Charter, clippings, correspondence, financial records, founding documents, legal records, list of members, minutes of meetings, printed matter, and speeches, relating to the activities and functioning of the Russian Center of San Francisco, Inc., and its predecessors - the Russian Club, Russkoe Natsional'noe Ob"edinenie, and others, arranged alphabetically by physical form

Articles, charter, clippings, correspondence, court records, financial records, minutes of meetings, poster, program, miscellany, arranged alphabetically by physical form, relating to the operations of Russkaia zhizn', published in San Francisco, California
Clippings, correspondence, writings, and printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject
Booklets, clippings, journals, and newspapers, arranged alphabetically by physical form, and therein by author or title
Newspapers and scrapbooks, arranged alphabetically by physical form, and therein by title (for newspapers) and subject (for scrapbooks)

Two albums depicting the construction of the Khukhai Railway, one album depicting events and people associated with the newspaper Russkaia zhizn', 69 loose prints and four negatives, depicting subjects such as the Russian Center of San Francisco, Anna Marly, the 22nd Invalids' Ball, President Dwight D. Eisenhower with A. S. Loukashkin

note.p: See also RUSSIAN CENTER OF SAN FRANCISCO FILE and RUSSKAIA ZHIZN' FILE for speeches and reports made to the boards of directors and general meetings of members of these organizations, and SUBJECT FILE for Loukashkin's speeches and writings (primarily anniversary notes, polemics, letters to the editor, and similar matter for newspapers) relating to Boy scouts and other subjects of interest to Loukashkin

did.unittitle: Translations of Russian-language articles by others on sardines, 1952-1954.
Introduction to N. A. Baikov and I. V. Kozlov, "Ekskursii v dolinu reki Mudan'tszian," n.d.
Introduction to N. N. Gomboev, Man'chzhuria glazami okhotnika, n.d.
"Novye ornitologicheskie nakhodki i nekotorye nabliudeniia nad ptitsami Severnoi Man'chzhurii," Vestnik Man'chzhurii, 1934.
"The Tarbagan or the Transbaikalian Marmot and Its Economic Value," Comptes rendus du XIIe Congrès international de zoologie, 1935 (offprint dated 1937).
"The Tarbagan or the Transbaikalian Marmot as a Carrier of Plague," Comptes rendus du XIIe Congrès international de zoologie, 1935 (offprint dated 1937).
"Mammals, Collected by the Dalai-Khingan Zoological Expedition of Manchuria Research Institute at Harbin, in 1935," Bulletin of the Institute of Scientific Research, Manchoukuo, 1937 June.
"Mammals found on the Territory of Greater Harbin," Report of the Institute of Scientific Research, Manchoukuo, 1938 August.
"On the Avifauna of North Manchuria," Report of the Institute of Scientific Research, Manchoukuo, 1939 March.
"Fragments on the Question of Natural Food of Some North Manchurian Birds," Report of the Institute for Horse-Diseases, 1940.

"The General Report and Diary of the Assistant to the Chief of the Expedition of the Scientific Research Institute in the Region of Wutalienchieh in the Summer of 1937," Bulletin of the Institute of Scientific Research, Manchoukuo, 1940 June.
"On the Pikas of North Manchuria," Journal of Mammalogy, 1940 November 14.
"On the Hares of Northern Manchuria," Journal of Mammalogy, 1943 February.
"A Preliminary Report on the Behavior of the Pacific Sardine (Sardinops Caerulea) in an Electrical Field, " Proceedings of the California Academy of Sciences, 1952 April 16.
"Further Studies of the Behavior of the Pacific Sardine (Sardinops Caerulea) in an Electrical Field," Proceedings of the California Academy of Sciences, 1954 July 9.
"On the Pacific Sardine (Sardinops Caerulea Girard) in Aquaria: Transportation, Handling, Maintenance, and Survival," Proceedings of the California Academy of Sciences, 1955 June 30.
"Pusanskii gubernator: Svetloi pamiati Dimitriia Gerasimovicha Romanova," 1967 March 1.
"K bibliografii dal'nevostochnoi pressy: Studencheskaia pressa Kharbina," Novyi zhurnal, 1974.
"Mongol'skie elementy v faune mlekopitaiushchikh v Severnoi Man'chzhurii," Zoologicheskii zhurnal, 1975.
RUSSIAN CENTER OF SAN FRANCISCO FILE, 1930-1975

scopecontent.p: Documents relating to the theft of funds

did.unittitle: Members of the Russian Center Executive Committee, 1946-1969
Flyers and bulletins of the Russian Center, 1940 and 1950, and undated
Speeches by unidentified persons, 1953 and undated
Exhibition of Russian artists in the Russian Center, 1952
Project of the pin for the Russian Center, 1940
Rossiiskii Politicheskii Komitet v N'iu Iorke, 1953-1954
Russian Club, San Francisco. Liquidation records, 1937

note.p: See also OVERSIZE FILE/Scrapbooks/Russkaia zhizn' and PHOTOGRAPHS

did.unittitle: American Committee for the Liberation of the People of Russia and United States Information Agency, 1952-1954
Historical sketch about the origins of Russkaia zhizn'
Poster for the 25th anniversary of Russkaia zhizn'

scopecontent.p: Clippings about him and reviews of his books

Includes clippings, correspondence, printed matter and writings relating to the history of scouting in pre-Revolutionary Russia and Russian Boy scout organizations abroad following the Revolution, especially in the United States
Brochures, bulletins and documents on inter-war China, published in Chinese and English in China
Correspondence, reports, and other documents relating to the Railway, including a chronology of events prepared for the 25th anniversary (1922) and summaries of the local and foreign press for 1919
Clippings on Russian Baptists, Dukhobors, Molokans, and Old Believers in Canada, Russia, the Soviet Union and the United States
Clippings from Russian émigré newspapers on Japanese-Soviet and Sino-Japanese relations, including the Japanese occupation of Manchuria
Clippings relating primarily to the history of the Kamchatka Peninsula in the 18th and 19th centuries and the founding of Petropavlovsk-na-Kamchatke

did.unittitle: Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco.

scopecontent.p: Includes draft of by-laws, correspondence, reports and other matter pertaining to the Museum's activities
Clippings, speeches and a report by V. M. Rudnev entitled "Pravda o russkoi tsarskoi sem'e i temnykh silakh" (Ekaterinodar, 1919)
Clippings relating to historical figures and events, 1905-1907, 1911-1912, and 1915

note.p: See also Russo-Japanese War, 1904-1905, and Miscellany/Clippings.

scopecontent.p: Clippings and writings relating to military and naval battles, educational establishments, and training, as well as biographical information on various officers. Includes material on the First World War
Includes information about the evacuation of Russians from China following the Second World War, and on displaced persons in general

The bulk of these clippings, other printed matter, and correspondence, relates to conflicts over the construction of the Russian Orthodox Cathedral on Geary Street, San Francisco, California, in the 1960s

did.unittitle: San Francisco Committee for the Aid of Russian Disabled Veterans Outside of Russia.

scopecontent.p: Clippings, correspondence, programs and other records relating primarily to the organization of benefit concerts and balls

note.p: See also Russia--History, Military--1801-1917, and Miscellany.

scopecontent.p: Includes clippings of a biographical nature on various individuals, primarily military leaders, involved in the Civil War (A. V. Kolchak, Iu. K. Stark, S. S. Tolstov, P. V. Vologodskii, and others)
Relates primarily to the Red Army and Navy in the inter-war period, with a significant volume on the Red Army in the Russian Far East

did.unittitle: Clippings of a biographical nature (predominantly obituaries) on various prominent Russians (mainly military men) active in the first half of the 20th century.

scopecontent.p: Indexed file includes materials on Adm. A. V. Kolchak, Gen. A. P. Kutepov, Gen. N. N. Iudenich, Gen. A. A. Vlasov, Prince Felix Iusupov, Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich, and others

note.p: see PRINTED MATTER/Clippings, which consists of clippings from various sources not organized by subject
